section.heading: Reference to extrinsic facts in plans or filed documents.

para.text: For the purposes of this subsection, the term:
“Filed record” means a record delivered to the Mayor for filing under any provision of this chapter except § 29-102.11.
“Plan” means a plan of domestication, business conversion, entity conversion, merger or membership exchange.

Whenever a provision of this chapter permits any of the terms of a plan or a filed record to be dependent on facts objectively ascertainable outside the plan or filed record, the following rules apply:
The manner in which the facts will operate upon the terms of the plan or filed record shall be set forth in the plan or filed record.
Any of the following that is available in a nationally recognized news or information medium either in print or electronically:
Market prices of any security or group of securities;
A determination or action by any person or body, including the corporation or any other party to a plan or filed record; or
The terms of, or actions taken under, an agreement to which the corporation is a party, or any other agreement or record.

annotations.annotation: Application of Law 19-210: Section 7 of D.C. Law 19-210 provided that the act shall apply as of January 1, 2012.
The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-210 substituted “delivered to the Mayor for filing” for “filed with the Mayor” in (a)(1).
